alert.note: Alert for Cook (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 26 at 10:16AM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Central Cook County, including Chicago. * WHEN...Until 1145 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Roads and streets may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1011 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a line of slow-moving thunderstorms from South Shore Chicago northward along the Lake Michigan shore. These storms are producing rainfall rates of 1-2 inches per hour and have caused minor flooding of some underpasses in portions of southeastern and central Chicago. Additional showers and storms are possible over the next couple hours. Additional rainfall may cause additional minor flooding. - Some locations that may experience minor flooding include... Chatham, South Chicago, South Shore, Hyde Park, Douglas, Near South Side, and Loop community areas of Chicago. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
